page.title: 17DAY IN LIFE OF BOY 1925
page.content: Stanley Bevan was born in Oakhill 72 yrs. ago. As a child his day began at 6.00am., when the first shift went to the brewery and he would do his odd jobs, giving any money he earned to his mother. At 8.00am. there was breakfast and he would roll his iron hoop to school for 9.00am. He attended the church school but it was not opened if there were less than 80 pupils. Children wore blazers, caps and hob nail boots, and got the cane if they were naughty. Lunch was bread and jam which he brought to school. He left school at the age of 12. The Brewery employed all the good men and he became a lorry driver for them. Wages were 16/- a week(rent was 3/-) The Brewery employed 100 people and he well remembers the night it burnt down and the heat was so bad his mother had to leave the house.
